metadata.title: CVE-2016-2532 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The dissect_llrp_parameters function in epan/dissectors/packet-llrp.c inthe LLRP dissector in Wireshark 1.12.x before 1.12.10 and 2.0.x before2.0.2 does not limit the recursion depth, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (memory consumption or application crash) via acrafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2532` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.0.2+ga16e22e-1
libwireshark6 - 2.0.2+ga16e22e-1
libwiretap5 - 2.0.2+ga16e22e-1
libwsutil6 - 2.0.2+ga16e22e-1
tshark - 2.0.2+ga16e22e-1
wireshark - 2.0.2+ga16e22e-1
wireshark-common - 2.0.2+ga16e22e-1
wireshark-gtk - 2.0.2+ga16e22e-1
wireshark-qt - 2.0.2+ga16e22e-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.2+ga16e22e-1').
